pageContext.description: Bevel around the cutting edge is very indistinct. Well finished "fish tail" hilt plate, quite flat without grooves or flanges. 6 rivet holes with one rivet attached. very true and even except that the hilt plate is very slightly bent - about 5mm out.
pageContext.patina: Black patina about the hilt plate + blade blright metal with some intense black patches giving a pie-bald effect.
pageContext.surface: Smooth. Very slightly corroded more on one side. There are some irregular lines and ridges suggesting that roots of plants have grown round the blade.
pageContext.collection: Museum of Archaeology + Ethnology, Cambridge,No. 188 Murray Collection
